The model can be used with the usual formula interface or using the `tidymodels` and `censored` structure.

Formula interface:

```{r}
library(lnmixsurv)

mod1 <- survival_ln_mixture(Surv(y, delta) ~ x,
  sim_data$data,
  starting_seed = 20
)

mod1
```

```{r eval = TRUE, include = FALSE}
library(lnmixsurv)
library(readr)

dir.create(file.path("data", "lnmixsurv"), showWarnings = FALSE)

if (!file.exists("data/lnmixsurv/model.rds")) {
  model <- survival_ln_mixture(Surv(y, delta) ~ x,
    sim_data$data,
    starting_seed = 20
  )

  write_rds(model, "data/lnmixsurv/model.rds")
}

mod1 <- read_rds("data/lnmixsurv/model.rds")

mod1
```

Tidymodels approach:

```{r}
library(censored)

mod_spec <- survival_reg() |>
  set_engine("survival_ln_mixture", starting_seed = 20) |>
  set_mode("censored regression")

mod2 <- mod_spec |>
  fit(Surv(y, delta) ~ x, sim_data$data)
```

```{r eval=TRUE, include=FALSE}
library(censored)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(purrr)

mod_spec <- survival_reg() |>
  set_engine("survival_ln_mixture", starting_seed = 20) |>
  set_mode("censored regression")

if (!file.exists("data/lnmixsurv/model2.rds")) {
  model <- mod_spec |>
    fit(Surv(y, delta) ~ x, sim_data$data)

  write_rds(model, "data/lnmixsurv/model2.rds")
}

mod2 <- read_rds("data/lnmixsurv/model2.rds")
```

The estimates are easily obtained using tidy method. See `?tidy.survival_ln_mixture` for extra options.

```{r eval = TRUE}
tidy(mod1)
tidy(mod2)
```

The predictions can be easily obtained from a fit.

```{r prediction}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(purrr)

models <- list(formula = mod1, tidymodels = mod2)

new_data <- sim_data$data |> distinct(x)
pred_sob <- map(models, ~ predict(.x, new_data,
  type = "survival",
  eval_time = seq(120)
))

bind_rows(pred_sob, .id = "modelo") |>
  group_by(modelo) |>
  mutate(id = new_data$x) |>
  ungroup() |>
  unnest(cols = .pred) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = .eval_time, y = .pred_survival, col = id)) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~modelo)
```

```{r echo = FALSE, eval = TRUE, fig.width=7}
models <- list(formula = mod1, tidymodels = mod2)

new_data <- sim_data$data |> distinct(x)

if (!file.exists("data/lnmixsurv/pred_sob.rds")) {
  pred_sob <- map(models, ~ predict(.x, new_data,
    type = "survival",
    eval_time = seq(120)
  ))

  write_rds(pred_sob, "data/lnmixsurv/pred_sob.rds")
}

pred_sob <- read_rds("data/lnmixsurv/pred_sob.rds")

bind_rows(pred_sob, .id = "modelo") |>
  group_by(modelo) |>
  mutate(id = new_data$x) |>
  ungroup() |>
  unnest(cols = .pred) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = .eval_time, y = .pred_survival, col = id)) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw() +
  facet_wrap(~modelo)
```
